page.title: 01General Information
page.content: The main centres of population of this block are the villages of Winterbourne Frampton Cotterell and Coalpit Heath situated a few miles to the north east of Bristol close to the M4 motorway. Originally employment in the area centred upon agriculture whilst later quarrying, hatting and the mining of both coal and iron played their part in the local economy. Today the old industries have disappeared but market gardening and farming are still important, the former taking advantage of the rich red marl of which much of the area is composed. Whilst the region is still largely rural in nature the villages have expanded to become large residential centres with many local people working in Bristol or in the aircraft and aerospace industries at Filton.
